title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 11 June 2009 - XWiki
content:

arunreddy joined #xwiki at 06:38  
jvelociter left at 06:52 ()  
jvelociter joined #xwiki at 07:47  
vnkatesh joined #xwiki at 07:51  
lucaa left at 08:35 ("Leaving.")  
vmassol joined #xwiki at 08:39  
asyd - (11/06/2009 08:39): hello there  
vnkatesh - (11/06/2009 08:39): anyone knows how to access cvs repository behind a firewall that refuses connection to port 2401 (other than tunneling?)  
asyd - (11/06/2009 08:40): ssh?  
vnkatesh - (11/06/2009 08:40): not possible :(  
vnkatesh - (11/06/2009 08:40): not working.  
arunreddy - (11/06/2009 08:52): vmassol : Hi  
vmassol - (11/06/2009 08:52): arunreddy: hi  
arunreddy - (11/06/2009 08:52): A draft on Media Wiki Export : http://gsoc.myxwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Import+Export+other+wikis/MediaWiki+Features  
arunreddy - (11/06/2009 08:52): Some comments.  
vmassol - (11/06/2009 08:57): reading  
arunreddy - (11/06/2009 08:58): ok :)  
vmassol - (11/06/2009 09:02): arunreddy: ok read  
mflorea joined #xwiki at 09:02  
vmassol - (11/06/2009 09:02): it's good to see the full list of stuff to convert  
vmassol - (11/06/2009 09:04): what's important is to have a design that allows converting them all fine. Now in term of implementation you should start simple and only convert the most important first and then add more and more coversion featrures till we get a perfect or acceptable conversion  
vmassol - (11/06/2009 09:04): arunreddy: what's your next step?  
arunreddy - (11/06/2009 09:04): yeah.   
vmassol - (11/06/2009 09:05): arunreddy: have you posted your action plan somewhere?  
vmassol - (11/06/2009 09:05): with dates and milestones?  
vmassol - (11/06/2009 09:05): I don't remember eeing it  
vmassol - (11/06/2009 09:05): s/eeing/seeing/  
vmassol - (11/06/2009 09:05): this is really important to do  
arunreddy - (11/06/2009 09:05): little confused. whether to head on with XML dumps .. or Direct Database .  
vmassol - (11/06/2009 09:06): you're going to miss the deadlines and not succeed if you don't do a planning and respect it  
arunreddy - (11/06/2009 09:06): yeah i did one. but not happy with the planning.   
lucaa1 joined #xwiki at 09:06  
vmassol - (11/06/2009 09:06): re XML vs DB I couldn't understand well enough what you wrote to decide (for ex you say with XML it's missing link metadata but I have no clue what this means)  
vmassol - (11/06/2009 09:07): best of course is to have a design that allows both  
vmassol - (11/06/2009 09:07): and have the max of code in common for both strategies  
arunreddy - (11/06/2009 09:07): OK.  
vmassol - (11/06/2009 09:07): so basically XML or DB code would implement a Data source interface  
vmassol - (11/06/2009 09:08): and all the code thereafter will simply use the Data source interface to do its job  
vmassol - (11/06/2009 09:08): the XML/DB access layer will simply populate that data source object with whatever info they can gather  
vmassol - (11/06/2009 09:08): something like this  
vmassol - (11/06/2009 09:09): so you abstract the data and how you get it  
vnkatesh - (11/06/2009 09:10): vmassol: I've integrated your standalone renderer for xeclipse.  
vnkatesh - (11/06/2009 09:10): vmassol: scripting is not supported right?  
vmassol - (11/06/2009 09:10): vnkatesh: cool  
vnkatesh - (11/06/2009 09:10): vmassol by the renderer?  
vmassol - (11/06/2009 09:10): vnkatesh: it is   
vmassol - (11/06/2009 09:10): but you need to understand something  
vnkatesh - (11/06/2009 09:11): vmassol: yes?  
arunreddy - (11/06/2009 09:11): Get the content from data source .. Parse it  and create the dump in the temp directory. and use the same to render XWIKI the pages.  
vmassol - (11/06/2009 09:11): vnkatesh: I haven't separated some macros yet, meaning they need access to a DocumentAccessBridge to work.They are: script macro, include macro and useravatar macro  
vmassol - (11/06/2009 09:12): vnkatesh: can you explain to me what you're working on?  
vmassol - (11/06/2009 09:13): vnkatesh: since I don't understand why you need the rendering  
vnkatesh - (11/06/2009 09:13): vmassol: standalone renderer for xeclipse. (Instead of the inbuilt-browser that shows the page-preview)  
vnkatesh - (11/06/2009 09:13): vmassol I'd be rendering the content locally..  
vmassol - (11/06/2009 09:13): vnkatesh: hmmm I don't think this is the way to do it  
arunreddy - (11/06/2009 09:13): vmassol : Can i stick to this three step process :  Datasource > temp dump > XWiki Pages.  
vmassol - (11/06/2009 09:14): vnkatesh: we've discussed this several times in the past and the idea is to include a standalone XE in XEclipse instead  
vmassol - (11/06/2009 09:14): vnkatesh: you should discuss this on the dev list before doing more work IMO  
vnkatesh - (11/06/2009 09:14): ok, I will.  
vmassol - (11/06/2009 09:14): arunreddy: sure, if you really need the dump  
arunreddy - (11/06/2009 09:17): Yes. the files are really huge at times. and at times they have back links. Holding them in memory will be a bit difficult. If we have a  temp dump in a standard way . we can use them same for others too.  
arkub joined #xwiki at 09:19  
trifon joined #xwiki at 09:19  
vmassol - (11/06/2009 09:20): arunreddy: the size of the files doesn't matter  
vmassol - (11/06/2009 09:20): since you'll need to set the content of the XWiki Document anyway  
vmassol - (11/06/2009 09:20): and that takes a String API  
vmassol - (11/06/2009 09:20): so you'll need it in memory anyway  
vmassol - (11/06/2009 09:20): what matters is not to hold several pages in memory  
vmassol - (11/06/2009 09:20): (ie work page by page)  
vmassol - (11/06/2009 09:21): and if this cannot be done then I agree a temp dir will help  
lucien joined #xwiki at 09:22  
arunreddy - (11/06/2009 09:22): the process includes .. fetching the data from db.. parsing it.. rendering it to xwiki syntax and creating a xwiki document.  
arunreddy - (11/06/2009 09:23): and there are few things like ( XWiki Internal Links ) which are taken care of at run time.  
arunreddy - (11/06/2009 09:23): and that will be  a problem.  
arunreddy - (11/06/2009 09:23): So the one in my mind is .. create the dump in  a xwiki friendly way..   
arunreddy - (11/06/2009 09:23): Using that we can customise the whole import process.  
arunreddy - (11/06/2009 09:26): Handling macros will be easier.

dignan is now known as jpdota ([[email protected]](https://dev.xwiki.org/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection))  
jpdota - (11/06/2009 19:55): Hi, I'm trying to set up XWiki for LDAP authentication, but I'm not having any luck is there anyone here who can help me configure it?  
sdumitriu - (11/06/2009 19:56): tmortagne  
jpdota - (11/06/2009 19:56): Thanks  
tmortagne - (11/06/2009 19:58): jpdota: hi  
tmortagne - (11/06/2009 19:59): did you looked at http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/AdminGuide/Authentication ?  
jpdota - (11/06/2009 19:59): tmortagne: hi, yes I have  
tmortagne - (11/06/2009 19:59): what is the issue ?  
jpdota - (11/06/2009 19:59): tmortagne: I'm not quite sure what I should put for bind\_DN, maybe it's not the issue but it won't authenticate  
jpdota - (11/06/2009 20:00): Also, do I have to restart the servlet every time I change the config?   
tmortagne - (11/06/2009 20:00): bind\_DN and bind\_pass are the "main" login/pass to connect to LDAP server  
jpdota - (11/06/2009 20:01): Oh, those aren't the authenticating username/pass then...  
tmortagne - (11/06/2009 20:01): you can put some admin user or even a pattern for LDAP auth to use the user which is connecting to xwiki  
tmortagne - (11/06/2009 20:01): it depends if users have right to list groups and things like that  
jpdota - (11/06/2009 20:01): Isn't that relatively insecure?  
tmortagne - (11/06/2009 20:02): why ?  
jpdota - (11/06/2009 20:02): putting in an actual password into the config?  
tmortagne - (11/06/2009 20:03): putting a clear password somewhere is already an issue but here your are supposed to put password only if all the other way don't work  
sdumitriu - (11/06/2009 20:03): Normally nobody should have access to it  
tmortagne - (11/06/2009 20:03): already=always  
jpdota - (11/06/2009 20:03): what other way?  the pattern you were talking about?  
tmortagne - (11/06/2009 20:04): jpdota: if your users has right to list groups on ldap server you don't need to put admin login/pass  
tmortagne - (11/06/2009 20:04): which ldap server are you using ?  
jpdota - (11/06/2009 20:04): I'm using an Mac OS X server Open Directory/LDAP  
tmortagne - (11/06/2009 20:04): yes look at the documentation, {0} is the login and {1} the password provided by the usr which is connection from XWiki  
jpdota - (11/06/2009 20:04): I've logged into it using an LDAP Browser/Editor  
tmortagne - (11/06/2009 20:05): when a user is tring to connect {0} and {1} are replaced before trying to connect to LDAP server  
jpdota - (11/06/2009 20:06): Right, that's what I figured  
jk\_work joined #xwiki at 20:07  
tmortagne - (11/06/2009 20:08): when you think you have all right and don't understand what is failing you can enable debug mode, see http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/AdminGuide/Authentication#HEnableLDAPdebuglog  
jpdota - (11/06/2009 20:08): Oh great!  That's something I was looking for  
tmortagne - (11/06/2009 20:08): the authenticator will print in the log all it is doing  
tmortagne - (11/06/2009 20:11): jpdota: i will have to go now sorry but if you still have issues after debuging send mail on the user mailing list  
jpdota - (11/06/2009 20:11): tmortagne: Alright thank you!  
tmortagne - (11/06/2009 20:12): you are welcome :)  
tmortagne left at 20:12 ("Ex-Chat")
